metadata.description:
Our mission is to make every search interaction meaningful & rewarding, through developer-friendly and enterprise-grade APIs.

Algolia is the leading Search & Discovery API for websites and mobile apps. We help the most innovative companies across e-commerce, media and SaaS industries create powerful, relevant and scalable discovery experiences for their users. Unlike other solutions, our hosted platform reduces the complexities of building and scaling a fast, relevant digital experience and helps teams accelerate development time. More than 9,000 companies like Under Armour, Twitch, Periscope, Medium and Stripe rely on Algolia to manage 50+ billion search queries a month.

Founded in 2012, we're backed by $184M in funding from Accel Partners, Alven Capital, Point Nine Capital and Storm Ventures. The team is headquartered in San Francisco with offices in Paris, London, New York, and Atlanta. To learn more, visit www.algolia.com.

---
We’re looking for talented, passionate people to build the world’s best search technology. As an ownership-driven company, we seek team members who thrive under autonomy and diversity. 

We're committed to building an inclusive and diverse workplace. We care about each other and the world around us, and embrace talented people regardless of their race, age, ancestry, religion, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, marital status, color, veteran status, disability and socioeconomic background
metadata.founder_1_description: Nicolas is currently a general partner at YC. He is also the co-founder of Algolia (YC W14), a growth stage Search API used by millions of developers. He has a PhD in Computer Science from the University of Nantes.

metadata.description:
Artemis Search is a vector database search with a twist. We use special-purpose deep-learning models instead of using textual / semantic similarity to evaluate how good a search result is.

This enables us to actually reason how well search results match the intent of the search query, eliminating the problems that come from evaluating search results on how much they look like the search query.

metadata.founder_2_description: Manvir is a self-taught software engineer who specializes in building robust and intuitive technology accessible to clients from all backgrounds. He has coordinated with his co-founder, Austin, on previous ventures and looks forward to bringing his experience to bear with Artemis.

metadata.description:
We are on a mission to build the world’s most accurate search engine over complex and unstructured documents.

Most AI products - whether Q&A bots or AI agents - depend on retrieval systems to provide relevant context from knowledge bases.

Yet, the vast majority of these systems rely on basic semantic or hybrid search methods, which still frequently fail. 

These mistakes lead to inaccurate responses and hallucinations by LLMs, frustrating developers and end users alike. 

That is why we’re building ZeroEntropy: to add intelligence to retrieval and empower developers to create AI products that are more reliable and accurate.

cofounder & CEO @ ZeroEntropy (YC W25)
-
moroccan founder with 2 masters in applied maths from École Polytechnique and UC Berkeley
metadata.founder_2_description:
Cofounder & CTO @ ZeroEntropy (YC W25) -

My background is in theoretical mathematics and computer science.

Dropped out of CMU to pursue startups. Worked on low-level C/C++/Assembly/GPU Code. CTO and/or main dev for 5 different startups. Created stat-arb algorithms and audited blockchains for bug bounties and hedge fund due diligence.

Built the AI @ myko.ai, manifestapp.xyz, magibook.co
metadata.generated_description:
**ZeroEntropy: Revolutionizing Search for AI**

ZeroEntropy is a San Francisco-based startup on a bold mission—to create the world’s most accurate search engine tailored for dealing with complex, unstructured documents. Founded in 2024 and part of the Y Combinator Batch W25, this two-person team is setting out to tackle a pervasive issue in the world of AI.

In an age where AI products like Q&A bots and virtual assistants rely heavily on retrieval systems, the limitations of current methods are glaring. Most existing systems employ basic semantic or hybrid search techniques that often miss the mark, leading to inaccuracies and frustrating hallucinations generated by large language models (LLMs). This isn't just a minor inconvenience; it can derail entire projects and erode trust in AI capabilities.

ZeroEntropy aims to change all that. By infusing its search API with enhanced intelligence, the company is empowering developers to build AI applications that are not only more reliable but also significantly more accurate. This dual focus on precision and user experience sets ZeroEntropy apart in a crowded field of Developer Tools.

With Harj Taggar as their Group Partner, the startup is poised to make waves in the realms of search, AI, and developer tools. If you’re interested in learning more or diving into the details of their offerings, check out their website at [zeroentropy.dev](https://www.zeroentropy.dev).

In summary, ZeroEntropy is tackling a core problem in AI—search accuracy over unstructured data—with a fresh perspective that aims to elevate the capabilities of AI products everywhere. Watch this space; they may just be the solution the industry has been waiting for.
metadata.headline: High accuracy search API over unstructured data.
metadata.name: ZeroEntropy

**Trieve: Simplifying AI-Powered Search**

Founded in 2023 and currently part of Y Combinator’s Batch W24, Trieve is a San Francisco-based startup on a mission to revolutionize the way search and recommendations are done. With a relatively small team of just 7 employees, Trieve is tackling one of the most complex problems in tech: building an effective search infrastructure.

At its core, Trieve serves as an all-in-one API designed for search, retrieval-augmented generation (RAG), and recommendations. Think of it as the ultimate toolkit for developers who want to integrate sophisticated search capabilities into their applications without the usual hassle. Historically, creating a robust search function could take months, but Trieve promises a production-ready solution that works right out of the box.

### What Sets Trieve Apart?

Trieve combines cutting-edge search language models with advanced tools that allow teams to fine-tune their search results. The features include:
- **Semantic Vector and Hybrid Search**: Out-of-the-box support for both semantic and full-text search.
- **Custom Models and Embedding Options**: A flexible infrastructure that allows for stock or custom embedding models.
- **Relevancy Tuning**: Fine-tune search results and boost performance via an API or a no-code dashboard.
- **Comprehensive Coverage**: From chunking data to providing analytics, Trieve covers all bases with its API.

This comprehensive approach lets teams manage everything from ingestion to analytics with ease. For those with stringent data requirements, Trieve even offers self-hosting capabilities.

### Use Cases and Applications

Today, Trieve is already powering over 30,000 discovery experiences across various sectors, including e-commerce and analytics. Companies leveraging Trieve can build a competitive edge by enhancing their search functionality and overall user experience.

### Why Choose Trieve?

If you want to set up industry-leading search capabilities in under 30 minutes, Trieve is your go-to solution. By simply uploading data, integrating the API, and tweaking search parameters, businesses can have a sophisticated search engine up and running without extensive downtime or ongoing maintenance burdens. 

In short, if search is a crucial component of your product, or if you’re committed to building an exceptional discovery experience, Trieve positions itself as a powerful partner. For a closer look at what Trieve can do, visit their website at [trieve.ai](https://trieve.ai) or request a demo to see the magic in action.
metadata.headline: All-in-one API for search, RAG, & recommendations

metadata.description:

Andi is a new type of search engine that uses generative AI and language models combined with live data to generate factually correct answers to questions, and to explain and summarize information combined from the best sources. 

Andi works as a search chatbot that's ad-free and privacy-focused. Ask Andi to...

✅  Answer questions
🧠  Find, summarize and explain information
🔍  Navigate and search the web

Search is broken because of SEO spam, ads, and surveillance capitalism. Andi cuts through the clutter to get you straight to the knowledge you need. It presents results visually in a way that's easy to understand with a simple chat interface, and protects you from ad tech and distraction.

metadata.generated_description:
### Andi: The Future of Search

**Overview**  
Andi is a search engine reimagined. Founded in 2021 and initially backed by Y Combinator's W22 batch, Andi leverages the latest advancements in generative AI to transform how we find information online. Based in San Francisco, it operates with a small, focused team of two, including a group partner named Nan.

**Mission**  
Andi's mission is straightforward: "Search for the next generation using generative AI." This reflects its commitment to providing a user-friendly, intelligent search experience—like having a conversation with a knowledgeable friend rather than sifting through links and ads.

**What Makes Andi Unique?**  
Traditional search engines often drown users in SEO-optimized spam, intrusive ads, and endless tracking. Andi cuts through this clutter. Here’s how:
- **Chat-Based Interface**: Andi operates as a chatbot, allowing users to ask questions naturally and receive concise, accurate answers.
- **Privacy-Focused**: There are no ads or tracking. Your queries remain your own.
- **Visual Results**: Information is presented in a visually appealing and digestible format, making it easier to understand complex topics.

**Core Features**  
- ✅ **Instant Answers**: Ask Andi anything, from "how to lose belly fat" to "best places for digital nomads," and get reliable, succinct responses.
- 🧠 **Information Summarization**: Andi can find, summarize, and explain information from the best sources available, enhancing your understanding of any subject.
- 🔍 **Web Navigation**: With Andi, you can navigate the web more efficiently, sidestepping the usual distractions found in traditional search engines.

**The Verdict**  
Andi is a refreshing take on search, aiming to enhance the user experience with cutting-edge AI while prioritizing privacy and simplicity. If you're fed up with endless scrolling and irrelevant ads, Andi might just be the smarter, more efficient solution you've been looking for. 

Check it out at [Andi's Website](https://andisearch.com) and experience search like never before.
metadata.headline: Search for the next generation using generative AI

We’ve rebuilt search from the ground up to address this. Our new approach employs high-quality LLMs to adaptively explore a database, mimicking how a human researcher carefully discovers information. This approach dramatically outperforms (by 10-50x) traditional keyword search and other modern AI-based retrieval methods.

Our first target users are the 50 million researchers searching for scientific literature on PubMed and Google Scholar every month. We’ve have users paying us $200-$500 per seat per year, from fields like medicine, ML, biotech, finance, and more.

#### What's Their Mission?

Downlink's mission is straightforward: to expedite the processing of LLMs significantly while keeping the integration process remarkably simple for developers. They achieve this by intelligently determining which prompts are straightforward and which ones require more computational power. Their solution intelligently routes less complex requests to faster models while your current LLM handles the more intricate queries.

#### Solutions for Developers

Downlink enhances your AI infrastructure by:
- **Boosting Performance**: Experience a performance increase of 20% or more without sacrificing accuracy, lowering response times, and expanding rate limits.
- **Simplifying Architecture**: Their drop-in API means less technical debt and complexity, allowing developers to focus on shipping rather than maintenance.
- **Getting Started Quickly**: Their service works seamlessly with various languages like Python, TypeScript, and Go, meaning you can plug it into your existing stack with ease. 

For example, a simple use case in Python looks like this:

```python
import openai

openai.base_url = "https://app.downlink.dev/api/v1"

response = openai.chat.completions.create(
    model="gpt-4o",
    messages=[{"role": "user", "content": "Say 'Hello World'"}]
)
```

#### A Lean Team, Big Ambitions

**ParadeDB: Postgres for Search and Analytics**

Founded in 2023 and emerging from Y Combinator's Batch S23, ParadeDB is making waves from its base in New York. It positions itself as a cutting-edge alternative to Elasticsearch, built on the robust infrastructure of PostgreSQL. Their mission? To harness the power of Postgres for enhanced search capabilities and real-time analytics, eliminating the complex overhead that often bogs down developers.

**What’s the Big Idea?**

At its core, ParadeDB aims to transform Postgres into a powerful search engine. It’s designed especially for real-time, update-heavy workloads, enabling teams to bypass the cumbersome synchronization tools typically associated with Elasticsearch. By leveraging the native strengths of Postgres, ParadeDB brings features like BM25 scoring, custom tokenizers, and hybrid search to the table, ensuring that developers can supercharge their data without the headaches of managing multiple systems.

**Key Features:**
- **Zero ETL:** Easily integrate with your existing infrastructure using native Postgres replication—no messy ETL processes required.
- **ACID Compliance:** Ensures your data is always searchable right after writing, thanks to Postgres’ transactional guarantees.
- **Automatic Cleanup:** No more worries about stale indexes; ParadeDB keeps everything tidy with Postgres’ vacuum process.
- **Open Source:** Trusted by a growing community, ParadeDB has already seen significant Docker deployments and Postgres extension installs.

**Community and Support**

ParadeDB is more than just a product; it’s a growing community. The company supports its users with rich documentation, a blog, and dedicated channels for feedback and collaboration. Their product has gained trust among enterprises while being loved by developers for its simplicity and effectiveness.

Whether you're part of a startup or a large organization, ParadeDB's focus on integrating seamlessly with managed Postgres services speaks volumes about its practicality. Notably, it supports data ingestion from various sources like Amazon RDS, Azure PostgreSQL, and Google Cloud SQL.

**In Summary**

ParadeDB is driving a paradigm shift in the way we think about search and analytics in the context of Postgres. With a talented team of four and strong backing from Y Combinator, they're poised for significant impact. If you’re eager to explore its capabilities, you can start with their [documentation](https://paradedb.com/docs.paradedb.com) or even book a demo to see it in action.

To follow their journey, connect on [GitHub](https://github.com/paradedb/paradedb), or join their [Slack community](https://join.slack.com/t/paradedbcommunity/shared_invite/zt-2lkzdsetw-OiIgbyFeiibd1DG~6wFgTQ). 

In a world where efficient data handling is crucial, ParadeDB is carving a niche that many will find hard to ignore.
metadata.headline: Postgres for Search and Analytics
metadata.name: ParadeDB

metadata.description:
Onyx is the AI assistant that connects to all your company tools and docs and makes finding any piece of information a breeze. Think ChatGPT, but with access to all your companies documents (only the ones you have access to, of course :P). Or, if you know Glean, you can think about it like an open-source Glean. 

Concerned about your data? Don't worry we're open source (MIT license) and built to be self-hosted. You can setup Onyx in your VPC in less than 30 minutes - no packets ever have to leave your cloud.

Check us out on Github: https://github.com/onyx-dot-app/onyx!

Former TL on the anti-fraud engine team at Robinhood.

In a previous life, was a top-100 NA League of Legends player.
metadata.generated_description:
### Company Overview: Onyx

**Founded:** 2023  
**Location:** San Francisco, CA  
**Team Size:** 6 employees  
**Y Combinator Batch:** W24  

---

**Mission:**  
Onyx aims to revolutionize workplace efficiency with its open-source AI assistant and enterprise search tool, designed to simplify how teams find, access, and utilize information.

**What is Onyx?**  
Imagine an AI assistant like ChatGPT, but tailored for your organization. Onyx seamlessly connects to all your company’s tools and documents, significantly reducing the time spent on searching for data. If you’re familiar with Glean, think of Onyx as its open-source counterpart. 

**Data Security:**  
One of the significant selling points of Onyx is its approach to data security. By being open-source and designed for self-hosting, Onyx allows companies to deploy their AI assistant within their virtual private cloud (VPC), ensuring that no data ever leaves an organization’s infrastructure. This means setting it up is not just easy, but securely contained in less than 30 minutes.

**Core Features:**

- **Integrations:** Onyx boasts over 40 integrations with popular applications like Asana, Google Drive, GitHub, and Slack, among others. This breadth allows users to sync data in real-time across multiple platforms seamlessly.
   
- **User-Friendly Interface:** Users can create AI assistants that leverage their organization's unique knowledge, ensuring that help is available right where work happens.

- **Advanced Document Access:** Onyx employs document-level permissions, enhancing security and ensuring that users only access what they need.

- **Customizable APIs:** Developers can utilize open-source APIs to build tailored workflows that suit their team's individual needs.

**Target Audience:**  
Onyx is built for everyone—from operational teams needing swift access to vital information to developers who require a robust platform for custom workflows.

---

**Current Initiatives:**  
1. **Assistants:** Creating bespoke AI assistants that cater to team-specific requirements.
2. **Search:** Enhancing the ability for organizations to locate information quickly across all integrated applications.
3. **OnyxBot:** A dedicated feature to facilitate real-time communication with the AI assistant.

### Join the Conversation  
Want to learn more? Get involved with the Onyx community via [Github](https://github.com/onyx-dot-app/onyx) or check out their official site at [onyx.app](https://www.onyx.app).

### Final Thought  
Onyx isn’t just another AI tool; it’s a lean, mean, information-finding machine, built with security and flexibility at its core. If you've been bogged down by information overload, Onyx might just be the solution that helps you unleash your team’s potential.
metadata.headline: Open Source AI Assistant and Enterprise Search
metadata.name: Onyx

Previously, I interned at Palantir where I built semantic search package which now powers many internal AI teams and worked on resource allocation engine at core infrastructure team. I also interned at Bloomberg where I scaled market tick processing pipeline by 10x to 10M ticks/s.
metadata.founder_2_description: Co-founder and CTO at Laminar (lmnr.ai). Previously, I have worked at Amazon for 2 years building and scaling critical payments infrastructure. Before that, I've spent a year creating ML infrastructure for a drug discovery biotech startup in Korea.
metadata.generated_description:
**Company Overview: Laminar**

**Founded:** 2024  
**Location:** San Francisco  
**Team Size:** 2 employees  
**Y Combinator Batch:** S24  
**Website:** [lmnr.ai](https://www.lmnr.ai)  

**Mission:** Laminar is on a mission to be the open-source, all-in-one platform for engineering AI products, aiming to streamline the development and management of AI systems.

---

**What They Do:**

Initially, Laminar started as a robust platform focused on observability, text analytics, evaluations, and prompt chain management for AI applications. They are carving out a niche in the AI landscape by offering tools that enhance the way teams trace, evaluate, and label AI models, specifically in the realm of large language models (LLMs).

**Key Features:**

- **Tracing:** Laminar allows developers to easily trace their LLM applications, providing clarity on each execution step. With just two lines of code, teams can collect valuable data for evaluations and fine-tuning.
  
- **Online Evaluations:** Teams can set up LLM or Python online evaluators to label spans automatically, making it easier to maintain accuracy without heavy reliance on human input.
  
- **Dynamic Few-shot Examples:** Users can build datasets from traces, enhancing their prompts by retrieving similar examples to fine-tune their models intelligently.
  
- **Serverless LLM Pipelines:** The platform offers a tool for building and iterating on both basic and complex LLM prompts, facilitating rapid prototyping and deployment.

- **Fully Open-source:** Laminar is designed to be fully open-source, allowing easy self-hosting and encouraging community contributions.

metadata.description: Directed Edge delivers Amazon-like "People who bought this also bought..." and "We think you'd also like"-style recommendations to other sites, using existing data being collected such as purchase or click histories. Recommendations are served in real-time via a REST API, with language bindings in several programming languages to make integration easy.
metadata.generated_description:
**Directed Edge Overview**

Directed Edge, a tech startup based in San Francisco, aims to transform e-commerce with its advanced product recommendation services. Think of those "People who bought this also bought..." suggestions you see on sites like Amazon—Directed Edge brings that capability to your online store through a seamless integration.

**Mission Statement**  
At its core, Directed Edge focuses on delivering precise product recommendations to enhance the shopping experience. Their technology analyzes existing purchase and click histories in real-time, offering insightful suggestions that foster increased sales and customer engagement.

**Background**  
Founded during Y Combinator's Summer 2009 batch, Directed Edge is a nimble team of just two employees. This startup ethos reflects its innovative drive and capacity to adapt quickly in a dynamic tech landscape.

**Product Features**  
Directed Edge’s primary product is a plugin for Shopify, where it has been remarkably successful, currently delivering over half a million recommendations per day. Here’s a glimpse of what their recommendation system offers:

- **Related Products:** Suggests items that are commonly paired with the product a customer views.
- **Shopping Cart Recommendations:** Offers suggestions based on the contents of a customer’s shopping cart.
- **Product Bundles:** Shows potential bundles of products available for a single purchase.
- **Personalized Recommendations:** Tailors suggestions for returning customers based on their previous interactions.
- **Top Products:** Highlights the most popular items in the user's shop.
- **Recently Viewed Products:** Keeps track of items a customer has viewed recently for quick reference.
- **Transactional Email Recommendations:** Incorporates recommendations into order and shipping confirmation emails.

**Additional Features**  
In addition to its core offerings, Directed Edge allows businesses to customize their recommendations through features like an advanced hand-picker for manually selecting products, business rule creations for tailored suggestions, and a CSV importer/exporter that simplifies the transfer of external data into their system.

**Why It Matters**  
At a time when e-commerce is saturated with options, effectively curating product suggestions can make or break customer experiences. Directed Edge’s approach leverages the power of artificial intelligence and machine learning to create a personal touch that retailers need to stand out.

**Key Takeaway**  
For businesses looking to harness the potential of AI-driven recommendations, Directed Edge provides a robust solution that promises not just to enhance sales, but also to improve customer satisfaction. Their integration simplicity and advanced features keep them at the forefront of e-commerce innovation.

If you're interested in elevating your online store’s performance, check out their services at [Directed Edge](http://directededge.com) or find them on the Shopify App Store.
metadata.headline: Product recommendations.
metadata.name: Directed Edge

Operand addresses this issue head-on by providing AI-driven insights that help brands optimize crucial areas like pricing, discount strategies, and marketing. The high data density present in these sectors allows Operand to demonstrate immediate impacts on the bottom line.

## How Does Operand Work?

Unlike many AI solutions that offer vague predictions, Operand has a unique spin: every result is vetted by human experts, many of whom have roots in top consulting firms (think McKinsey, BCG). This means that users benefit from AI's efficiency and data-crunching ability while gaining the confidence that comes from human expertise. Operand’s first capability focuses on pricing strategies, evaluating competitor pricing, advertising effectiveness, inventory levels, and more to help businesses maximize profits.

Operand is already making waves with early customers, reportedly driving six-figure improvements in their profit and loss statements. Brands are turning to Operand to replace the reliance on slow and cumbersome analytics processes that delay actionable insights.

- **Data Integration**: Operand connects to a variety of data sources, including platforms like Shopify, Amazon, Salesforce, Google Analytics, Google Ads, Meta, and Excel, creating a unified view of performance metrics. No more messy spreadsheets!
  
- **AI + Human Expertise**: Operand’s recommendations result from advanced algorithms, followed by expert review, ensuring accuracy before delivery. Reports are polished and tailored to fit the recipient’s needs.

- **Ongoing Optimization**: Operand continuously analyzes data and suggests adjustments, proactively responding to market changes (e.g., competitor pricing shifts) and ensuring that strategies evolve in real-time.

## Why Operand?

Companies in e-commerce need decision-making grounded in rigorous analysis, not guesswork. Operand empowers teams to ask the right questions and deliver insights that drive real results, all while saving time in reporting and analysis.

If you're looking for a way to up your e-commerce game and make data-driven decisions, Operand might just be the partner you need.

Proxis is an innovative startup aiming to revolutionize how businesses handle Large Language Models (LLMs). Founded in 2024 and currently part of Y Combinator's Batch S24, Proxis is based in San Francisco and has a team of one (yes, one) with hopes to scale up as they grow. 

Their mission? To provide a developer platform for LLM distillation and serving, making it easier for enterprise AI teams to optimize their models without relying on costly and less efficient closed-source options. 

Proxis's unique offering allows businesses to distill state-of-the-art models like Llama 405b, tuning them on proprietary data. The result? Models that are five times faster and ten times cheaper than traditional solutions. This has profound implications for AI teams who spend significant resources fine-tuning models like GPT-4. 

Key features of Proxis include:
- **Model Selection**: Choose the right model for your needs.
- **Fine-Tuning**: Tailor the model with your own data.

Founded in 2023 and hailing from the heart of San Francisco, Automorphic is a cutting-edge AI startup that’s part of the Y Combinator Batch S23. With a nimble team of three, the company's mission is to transform how knowledge is infused into language models, achieving this with an elegant approach that requires just 10 samples.

This not only enhances model capabilities but does so efficiently and cost-effectively.

Automorphic’s approach to knowledge infusion addresses the inefficiencies of traditional methods, like prompt stuffing—techniques that can only take you so far. Instead, Conduit empowers teams to rapidly iterate on their models with human-in-the-loop feedback, drastically cutting down on the time to deploy improvements. The models learn and adapt over time, continuously enhancing performance based on real user inputs.

Moreover, Conduit offers compatibility with the OpenAI API, allowing users to integrate the technology without having to overhaul their existing setups. For those concerned with data privacy, Automorphic also supports on-premises deployments, ensuring that sensitive information remains secure within clients' private cloud environments.

In a landscape where the demand for intelligent and adaptable language models is ever-increasing, Automorphic is positioned as a frontrunner—simplifying the way knowledge is integrated into AI and promising to empower developers in creating robust, self-improving models that evolve with their needs.

## Circlemind: The Next Generation of AI Memory Systems

Founded in 2024 and backed by Y Combinator's Batch F24, Circlemind is an ambitious startup based in San Francisco, California, focusing on evolving Retrieval Augmented Generation (RAG) methods through open-source innovations. At its core, Circlemind leverages the power of Knowledge Graphs and PageRank to enable efficient, context-aware, and interpretable AI reasoning and retrieval.

### Mission and Vision

Circlemind's mission is simple yet profound: to develop a next-generation memory system for AI that goes beyond the limitations of current RAG methodologies. By adopting a unique approach that combines vector databases with knowledge graphs, Circlemind can create intelligent systems that adapt to user-specific contexts, data, and queries.

### What Makes Circlemind Unique?

The cornerstone of Circlemind's technology is what's known as **GraphRAG**, a highly adaptable retrieval framework. Unlike traditional static RAG approaches, Circlemind's system continuously learns and evolves based on new data and interactions. This self-improving capability allows it to provide more nuanced and relevant responses to complex queries. Here are some of the standout features:

- **Promptable GraphRAG**: Users can command the AI's graph construction in plain English, ensuring the technology aligns closely with the user's intent and data specifics.
- **Multi-Hop Retrieval**: The system can reason across a network of memories, retrieving highly relevant information seamlessly.
- **Whole Dataset Reasoning**: Capable of handling complex queries that require an aggregate understanding of data, unlike naïve RAG systems that may struggle with holistic insights.
- **Dynamic Data Adaptation**: GraphRAG excels with evolving information, making it ideal for applications that require updated context retrieval.

### Pricing and Accessibility

Circlemind aims to democratize access to advanced AI tools. They offer a **Community Edition** that is free for self-hosting, making it accessible for hobbyists and small projects. For businesses needing advanced features and support, there’s a subscription model priced at **$300 per month**. Custom enterprise solutions are also available, catering to scalable team needs.

### The Team

With a compact team of three, Circlemind's efforts are supported by a robust partnership with industry expert **Diana Hu**, who brings valuable insights from her experience in cutting-edge technology development. 

### Conclusion

Circlemind is positioned to push the boundaries of AI technology by harnessing the strengths of most modern systems while addressing their deficiencies. Their innovative approach could redefine how AI interacts with the vast amounts of information available today, allowing for more sophisticated and intuitive applications. For a closer look or to experiment with their offerings, check out their website at [Circlemind](https://circlemind.co) and don’t hesitate to **book a demo** or start with **100 free credits** to explore their capabilities firsthand. 

In a world that craves smarter AI solutions, Circlemind's advancements could very well chart a new path forward.

### Alpas: Revolutionizing Procurement with AI

Founded in 2020 and part of Y Combinator’s W21 batch, Alpas has carved out a niche in the procurement software space, particularly targeting mid and large-cap manufacturing companies. Headquartered in Berlin, Germany, this five-person startup is on a mission: to help procurement departments find suppliers **10x faster**.

#### What Sets Alpas Apart?

Alpas employs machine learning methods to deliver a comprehensive, 360° view of suppliers and supply chains. metadata.description:
With AI increasingly automating away code generation, software engineers will spend more time reading, judging, and architecting code rather than writing it. Storia is building an open-source copilot that knows a company's codebase and its context.

We are starting with Sage, a Perplexity-like agent for helping developers understand, judge, and generate software. Given an existing codebase, developers can ask Sage questions such as:
1) Given my project’s SLA and latency constraints, what is the appropriate underlying vector database to use? How would I incorporate it into my existing codebase?
2) Why should I pick Redis over Milvus as my underlying vector store?
3) Does this codebase in our organization still work and what steps are required for a complex integration with another library?

Sage’s answers are directly supported by documentation and external references like GitHub, Stack Overflow, technical design documents, and project management software, preventing hallucinations. Today, Sage has up-to-date knowledge about open-source repositories (indexed daily). Tomorrow it will have a deep understanding of every line of code on the Internet. For teams, Sage will know about your private codebase too.

No group has yet solved how to build an AI system that comprehends a codebase and its context and can empower every developer to architect better code, faster. This requires new research advances because vanilla RAG and out-of-the-box LLMs aren’t going to cut it. 

We have 20+ years of software engineering and AI research experience. Julia worked on precursors of Gemini using contextual neural techniques before they were called “RAG” (and applied it to products like Google Keyboard and Pixel phones). Mihail built the earliest LLMs at Amazon Alexa and launched the first contextual deep learning conversational AI system in production at Alexa.
metadata.founder_1_description:
Cofounder @ Storia & previously at Google Research.

10+ years in NLP. Built the first bidirectional RNN for machine translation at Oxford. At Google, I helped build pivotal technologies like federated learning, the AI layer on top of Android, and RAG for precursors of Gemini. Excited about how NLP is now redefining software engineering.
metadata.generated_description:
**Storia AI: Revolutionizing Code Understanding with an Open-Source AI Copilot**

In the ever-evolving landscape of software engineering, Storia AI is carving out a unique niche. Founded in 2023 and currently part of Y Combinator Batch S24, Storia AI is on a mission to transform how developers interact with code. Their vision is straightforward yet ambitious: to build an open-source AI copilot that comprehensively understands a company's code and its broader context. 

As the industry moves towards automating code generation, software engineers increasingly find themselves in roles that require deep comprehension of existing code rather than just writing new lines. Storia AI tackles this shift head-on with a tool named Sage. Think of Sage as a smart assistant for developers—an AI that not only generates suggestions but truly understands the nuances of a specific codebase.

### What Can Sage Do?

Sage acts as a powerful resource for developers, capable of answering complex questions that go beyond simple coding tasks. Here’s what it offers:

1. **Contextual Recommendations**: Developers can consult Sage on technical choices, like determining the right vector database that meets project constraints.
2. **Comparative Analysis**: It can clarify why one database option might be more suitable than another—say, Redis versus Milvus.
3. **Integration Queries**: Sage assesses codebases for compatibility with other libraries and provides actionable steps for integration.

What sets Sage apart is its reliance on verified sources. Instead of generating potentially misleading information (a common issue known as "hallucination"), Sage provides answers anchored in a wealth of documentation from GitHub, Stack Overflow, and internal technical documents. This places reliable, contextualized knowledge directly in the hands of developers.

### A Strong Foundation

Storia AI was founded by a small but formidable team with deep roots in both AI and software engineering. Julia has extensive experience with contextual neural networks, having worked on foundational technologies at Google, while Mihail was instrumental in developing early LLMs (Large Language Models) at Amazon Alexa. Their 20+ years of combined experience positions them uniquely to tackle the challenges of building an AI that comprehends complex codebases.

### Where They’re Headed

Currently located in Millbrae, CA, Storia AI operates with a compact team of two talented individuals, backed by David Lieb as their Group Partner. The tagging of their work in areas like ‘artificial intelligence’, ‘developer tools’, and ‘machine learning’ indicates a focused strategy that resonates deeply within the tech community. As they progress, there are ambitious goals to deepen Sage’s understanding of not just private codebases but potentially every line of code available online.

In a nutshell, Storia AI is not just another tech startup; it's a thoughtful response to the inevitable evolution of software development. By building a bridge between AI and developers, they’re paving the way for more efficient, informed, and high-quality code architecture. If you’re interested in learning more or seeking support for your own codebase, check out their website at [storia.ai](https://storia.ai). 

Storia AI is a company to watch, not just for what they are building today but for how they will shape the future of coding.

Founded in 2023 and currently part of Y Combinator's Batch S24, Spherecast is a budding company on a mission: to become the ultimate AI Supply Chain Manager for e-commerce businesses. With a compact team of just five employees, Spherecast integrates artificial intelligence into inventory management to empower omnichannel brands in managing demand, optimizing stock levels, and enhancing supplier communication.

**What Spherecast Does**

At its core, Spherecast automates the intricate dance of inventory management. The software tells e-commerce brands when to reorder stock, how much to procure, and where to allocate it—all while negotiating costs. The magic happens through intelligent algorithms that not only suggest optimal orders but also automate the execution by liaising directly with suppliers and manufacturers. This approach is designed to minimize issues like stockouts, reduce overstock, and increase visibility within the supply chain—all critical factors in today's fast-paced e-commerce world.

### Key Features

1. **Automated Replenishment**: Spherecast can autonomously execute replenishment orders, drastically reducing the manual burden on supply chain teams.
  
2. **Inventory Optimization**: It provides strategic recommendations across multiple warehouses, ensuring optimal stock levels tailored to future demand and lead times.

3. **Omni-Channel Demand Planning**: Spherecast allows brands to forecast demand effectively across various sales channels, considering seasonal trends and anomalies in past sales data.

4. **Integration with NetSuite**: Spherecast syncs seamlessly with leading ERP systems like NetSuite, enhancing its utility for businesses already using these platforms.

5. **Availability of Metrics**: Users can gauge the health of their inventory and supply chain through accessible metrics, helping maintain a proactive approach.

### Why It Matters

In a world where e-commerce has become a staple, and consumer expectations are higher than ever, brands need robust tools to keep their supply chains agile. By eliminating tedious spreadsheet work and human error, Spherecast arms brands with the insights and automation necessary to stay competitive.

### Team and Support

Under the guidance of Group Partner Tom Blomfield, Spherecast promotes a culture of innovation and responsiveness to customer needs. The company pledges to improve its users' efficiency through customized solutions tailored to their unique inventory challenges.

### Conclusion

If you're looking to streamline your e-commerce supply chain and eliminate unnecessary headaches, Spherecast is setting the stage for a new era of AI-driven inventory management. They back their service with a 30-day money-back guarantee, making it easier for brands to test the waters and see the benefits for themselves.

**Catch them online at** [Spherecast.ai](https://www.spherecast.ai/) to book a demo or dive deeper into their offerings. This is one company to keep an eye on as they reshape the landscape of e-commerce logistics.
metadata.headline: AI Supply Chain Manager for Ecommerce

metadata.generated_description:
**Company Overview: Duckie**

Founded in 2023, Duckie is a San Francisco-based company that has quickly garnered attention as part of Y Combinator's Winter 2024 batch. The startup exists to empower customer support teams in the B2B SaaS space by integrating AI into their workflows. With a tiny team of two, they've set out with a clear mission: to enhance the efficiency and effectiveness of customer support.

**What Duckie Does**

Duckie offers an AI assistant specifically crafted for customer support teams. The product facilitates faster ticket resolution by integrating seamlessly into existing systems, whether it's Slack, Discord, Zendesk, or Intercom. Looking to provide support during onboarding or to clarify product updates? Duckie's got your back. It can scour through knowledge bases to deliver timely and relevant answers to both customers and support agents alike.

Key Features:
- **AI Support Agent:** Duckie can auto-respond to customer inquiries, offering instant solutions drawn from previous interactions.
- **AI Support Copilot:** This feature aids support agents by searching through organizational knowledge to find the right information quickly.
- **Log Investigation:** It helps technical teams troubleshoot by analyzing logs and code changes, allowing for faster issue resolution.
- **Auto-updates and Reminders:** By tracking product changes and code commits, Duckie keeps teams updated so they can respond more effectively to customer queries.

**Use Cases**

Duckie has a particular focus on technical users, making it an invaluable tool for sectors like developer tools and fintech. For instance, it can quickly furnish answers to complex technical questions, such as user permissions or data import/export capabilities. 

**Integration and Security**

Duckie's flexibility allows it to embed within various platforms and channels, ensuring that it can operate where customers are—be it on website widgets or as a bot in collaboration tools like Microsoft Teams and Slack. The platform is designed with enterprise-grade security, maintaining data integrity and compliance with GDPR and CCPA.

**Results So Far**

Initial reports from users suggest that Duckie significantly reduces resolution times—by up to 80%. They’re reporting substantial cost savings as well, with some teams saving over $210k annually. Additionally, Duckie has demonstrated a 71% ticket deflection rate, meaning many customer inquiries are resolved without needing to escalate.

**Closing Thoughts**

In a world where customer support teams are increasingly overwhelmed, Duckie positions itself as a crucial ally, transforming the way businesses interact with their customers. If you’re looking to supercharge your support operations, Duckie might just be the AI companion you need. Want to give it a try? Head to [Duckie's website](https://duckie.ai/) to start your free trial.

Duckie's mission to power customer support teams through AI could well define the future of customer service in tech—seamless, efficient, and, above all, user-friendly.

metadata.description:
Firecrawl is the easiest way to extract data from the web. Developers use us to reliably convert URLs into LLM-ready markdown or structured data with a single API call. We crossed 17k GitHub stars in just two months and have had paying customers since day one.

Previously, we built Mendable, one of the first commercially available “chat with your data” applications. We sold to companies like MongoDB, Coinbase, Snapchat, and more. To do this, we spent a surprising amount of time building reliable infrastructure for getting clean data from the web. When we started to see our founding friends rebuilding the same thing, we thought we might be on to something.
metadata.founder_1_description: CEO at Firecrawl
metadata.founder_2_description: Founder and CMO @ Firecrawl
metadata.generated_description:
Firecrawl is a San Francisco-based startup that emerged from Y Combinator's Summer 2022 batch. Founded by a team with a history of building successful data applications, Firecrawl's core mission is pretty straightforward: to provide the easiest way to extract AI-ready data from the web.

Initially branded to simply extract data from websites, Firecrawl has swiftly evolved into a powerful tool for developers. Its API allows users to take any URL and convert it into LLM (Large Language Model) ready markdown or structured data with just a single API call. The platform gained impressive traction, racking up over 17,000 GitHub stars in a mere two months and managing to secure paying customers from the start.

Before launching Firecrawl, the founders developed Mendable, a pioneering application for conversing with data, catering to high-profile clients like MongoDB, Coinbase, and Snapchat. Their past experience highlighted a common frustration: the complex and often unreliable processes involved in web data extraction. This insight laid the groundwork for Firecrawl’s streamlined approach.

### Key Features:
- **Robust Web Scraping**: Firecrawl can crawl and scrape data from all accessible subpages, returning clean markdown without needing a sitemap.
- **Dynamic Content Handling**: It accommodates sites that render content dynamically using JavaScript.
- **AI-Ready Data**: The content is structured effectively, enabling LLM applications to leverage it with minimal preprocessing.
- **Open Source**: True to modern tech ethos, Firecrawl is open-source, encouraging contributions and community involvement.

### User Experience:
Developers can kickstart their journey with Firecrawl for free (up to 500 credits), making it easy to try out the service before committing to a paid plan. Their pricing tiers offer flexible scaling options, which range from basic plans for hobbyists to comprehensive enterprise solutions.

Firecrawl has already attracted attention from notable companies and developers, who praise its reliability and efficiency in data preparation. Feedback suggests it's not just a tool but a valuable partner in ai-powered projects.

You can check out more or get started over at [Firecrawl's website](https://www.firecrawl.dev).

In summary, Firecrawl isn’t just joining the data extraction race—it's redefining how developers tap into the vast resources of the web to power their AI initiatives. With a refreshing focus on simplicity and reliability, Firecrawl is a compelling choice for anyone looking to enhance their data-driven applications.
metadata.headline: The easiest way to extract AI ready data from the web
metadata.name: Firecrawl

Modern teams work in the browser. But browsers weren't built for teams 😔. 

This leads to a bunch of problems like:
- Knowledge/info that is hard to find (links that get lost, documentation that gets, buried, silos, etc)
- Poor collaboration
- Inefficient workflows

LinkGrep is an AI browser copilot that solves those problems by making your browser team friendly.

Specifically we help teams:
1. 🔗 Keep track of links, documents, and more automatically. With LinkGrep you'll never have to manually add or save a link.
2. 🔍 Find information that matters. LinkGrep connects with your existing tools like Notion and Slack and will automatically suggest relevant information to you as your browse (we have semantic search that you can fallback on). Demo: https://youtu.be/jwcPGDRy4oQ

4. 🤖 Automate team actions like opening up the right links before a meeting. Never disrupt a meeting to send a link again. Demo: https://youtu.be/an3VKpAWft0
